intro: Bohadschia, commonly known as the rainbow wrasse, is a genus of marine fish belonging to the family Labridae. It is characterized by its vibrant coloration and elongated body shape, which vary among species. These fish are typically found in tropical and subtropical waters of the Indo-Pacific region. They are known for their distinctive patterns and can display a range of colors, including red, blue, and yellow. Bohadschia species play an important role in coral reef ecosystems as both predators and prey.
